intro: Oxytropis chinglingensis, commonly known as the Chingling locoweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect or semi-erect growth habit. The plant produces small, yellow to pale green flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are bipinnate, with numerous small leaflets, and it is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Oxytropis chinglingensis is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations.
